description.narrative:
GAD-C's project is supplementary to Value Development in Takeo and Siem Reap province. The project aim To build the capacity of Oxfam#s partners in applying the Gender Action Learning system (GALS) tool into value chains projects to improve the living conditions of vulnerable women and men by transforming gender roles and power relations towards gender justice and economic development.
Objective 1: 1) Build capacity of project holder#s staff on implementation the GALS tools in value chain developmentand agri-business project. 2. 2) Provide technical support to project holder#s staff in practicing the GALS tool in women in value chain development andagri-business project
Expected result: - Gender Action Learning System (GALS) tools were implemented in the value chains development and agri-business projects of Oxfam#s partners.

participating-org.narrative:
Originally founded as a project in 1997 under the umbrella organization Cambodian Cooperation Committee ,GAD/C has evolved into a specialist NGO involved in a wide array of efforts to achieve gender equality. GAD/C registered as an independent NGO in 2000.
Guided by its mission to promote gender equality in social, economic and political process in Cambodia, GAD/C works with the RGC and members of civil society to address gender issues by advocating policy formulation in line ministry strategic planning. GAD/C emphasizes the need to shift from a focus on women’s roles in development towards an analysis of gendered relations of power, including access to, and control over, resources and decision-making by women and men. GAD/C works simultaneously at several levels, from nationaland international networking and lobbying for policies and laws to local community mobilization. Working on a nationwide basis, GAD/C aims to mainstream gender across society by improving the information and knowledge base for gender mainstreaming, strengthening women's political leadership skills, expanding opportunities for women leaders, changing prevailing gender values and perceptions, and improving women's economic empowerment.
GAD/C carries out its activities through three programmes: ? Advocacy and Networking ? Training and Internship ? Community Outreach
The overall objectives of GAD/C’s projects are to: ? Establish and maintain effective advocacy networks of civil society, youth and government institutionsto create a demand for gender-sensitive laws, plans, and decision-making bodies to promote gender equality. ? Enable elected bodies, ministries, NGOs, and local institutions to integrate gender and implement gender-sensitive laws, policies, plans and programmes; ? Increase mutual recognition of and respect for the rights and contributions of men and women in the family, community and nation. GAD-C work has evolved as the organization and Cambodia have moved forward. GAD/C has been successful in carving out a leadership position among stakeholders in Cambodia, and over time all the stakeholders have succeeded in building awareness and commitment among all sectors.
In response to Cambodia’s development and successes on gender issues, GAD/C no longerfocuses on building general awareness about gender equality to broad audiences. For example, although GAD/C has long provided training courses to a wide range of organizations, it has begun to move toward a higher proportion ofcustomized training courses tailored to the needs of specific clients. Similarly, after years of advocacy for a Domestic Violence Law, GAD/C has broadened its scope to provide technical assistance and training on implementation of existing laws. Always a strong figure in nationaland local networks, GAD/C has built effective relationships with a wide range of stakeholders in government, civilsociety and local communities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
